TopicTitle: Vagani Car Manufacturers- Get Inspired- Final Challenge

Articles.Content:
Get Inspired

So I have given some thought to Zeke's comment 'Get Inspired' and have decided to do a competition in which you the wonderful imaginative audience create vehicles, and enter them into a competition where they will be put to the test against various categories.

How to participate:

1- Build a vehicle, i recommend using suspension, it might help you out.

2- Record a video or a series of screenshots of the craft like I do in my videos advertising the vehicle you have created.

3- Submit the craft to the new forum thread that can be found here, giving information such as cost, part count, top speed, etc

4- I will then come up with a series of events which you will take part in by recording them and submitting them on your ORIGINAL POST.

Challenges:

1st Challenge: Land your car on minmus

2nd Challenge: Post your top speed, a jump and a nice screenshot

3rd Challenge: Produce a bill board style advert of your car, it must have;-Your car in it

-The name of your car

-The cost

-Anything that makes it special (EG- My ATORV had 'ready for nature' as its slogon)

4th Challenge: the final challenge is to produce a short clip that shows your car, falling from a great height, this will be an advert, and so requires:

-The product

-Cost

-Features

-Your name at the end, and possibly your profile picture

-Inspirational music

-Epic camera shots, Kerbcam might help

Here is an example, not from KSP, but i want you to make something similar, and of course put a spin on it.

Upload the finished video to mediafire or what ever downloading thing, so that I can download it and watch it. Although if you do have a youtube channel, post it on there for simplicity, good luck.

PRIZES!!!

1st Place:

-Vehicle in the next pack and video on it

-Ability to play exclusively with me, with any game that can be found on my steam list

-The event can be recorded it is up to you to tell me if you are ok with it

-Shoutout for your Youtube channel or KSP forum page

-Exclusive chat about how I make my cars and other behind the scenes stuff

-Become a member of Vagni Car Manufacturers

2nd Place:

-Vehicle in the next pack and video on it

-Shoutout for your Youtube channel or KSP forum page

-Ability to play exclusively with me, with any game that can be found on my steam list

-Become a member of Vagni Car Manufacturers

3rd Place:

-Vehicle in the next pack and video on it

-Shoutout for your Youtube channel or KSP forum page

-Become a member of Vagni Car Manufacturers

Have fun and good luck -Get Inspired

I'm all for competition Vagani but wouldn't you be a better 'sport' by hosting a competition that doesn't involve everyone using your chassis?

Why not let people make their own cars and enter them.

That will result in more variety among the entries and make for a more interesting competition.

MJ

I look forward to seeing what people come up with!

You can expect speed, durability stuff like that, keep the craft file as it will be released in a pack, also I dont have a working pc atm so I'll take a peek when ive decided the winner
Can it be a vehicle which has already been posted in another thread?
Ermmm, If you can modify it and say its a different vehicle as I would like to see peoples independent building ability with the rules set so yes

You call that a small car? I've built VTOLs smaller than that!

(Here's the page for this)

With all due seriousness, though, I think that when you get much smaller than the vehicle I made, it doesn't look like a recognizable car anymore. With all due respect, your small vehicle could be considered a moped, though it looks a little like a train.

I personally see my car as being like a VW Beetle, though I see where Vagani is coming from when he says that it's more like a Smart Car. At any rate, I may be coming up with a new name for the little guy... stay tuned for a video showcasing the little car's features!

With all due seriousness, though, I think that when you get much smaller than the vehicle I made, it doesn't look like a recognizable car anymore. With all due respect, your vehicle could be considered a moped, though it looks a little like a train.

Edited September 5, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

This Craft Is No Longer In The Competition

some issues with performance led me to redesign my entry for better results in events

This post will remain here anyways though

Bugatti Veyron Super Sport Replica

(High Part Count)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Modeled after the world's fastest street car, the Bugatti Veyron Super Sport features a stunningly accurate, high detail, interior and exterior. A modified wheel configuration allows for moderate suspension and high acceleration for its weight. However, its high part count and complex structure means that it is not stable if you should be in a crash. To compensate for a low body, both bumpers have metal plates to shield the more fragile body from the ground when coming off a poor transition from a steep incline. The car handles wonderfully, and can handle even 90 degree turns at high speeds.

Specifications:

Top Speed: 21.2 m/s

Brake Quality: 6 sec. from 17 m/s to a complete stop

Acceleration: 10 sec. from complete stop to 17 m/s

Part Count: 328 parts

Cost: 231,238

Turn Rate: 13 sec. to complete a circle at 17 m/s
